text: Peter Michael Mayer (March 28, 1936 – May 11, 2018) was a British-born American publisher. He was born in London. Mayer was president of The Overlook Press/Peter Mayer Publishers, Inc., a Woodstock, New York-based publishing company he founded with his father in 1971. At the time of Overlook’s founding, Mayer was head of Avon Books, a large New York-based paperback publisher. From 1978 to 1996, Mayer was CEO of Penguin Books. Recently, Mayer financially revived both Ardis, a publisher of Russian literature in English, and Duckworth, an independent publishing house in the UK. Mayer died at the age of 82 in his home in Manhattan, New York, due to complications related to amyloidosis. ==References== Category:1936 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from amyloidosis Category:Disease-related deaths in New York City Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Businesspeople from London Category:Businesspeople from New York City
